cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the northern Caribbean, then forecast to turn northwest toward the Florida Keys and move northward over the Florida peninsula and eastern Gulf Coast.

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, including the central-west coast from Naples to Cedar Key (Tampa Bay region).
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are increasingly likely by late Sunday night or early Monday with a 47% 5-day cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and up to a 20% chance of 50-kt winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft or higher surge in and near Tampa Bay if the core tracks close to the west-central Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall capable of producing 4–8 inches (locally higher) and flash-flooding Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large battering waves, dangerous rip currents, possible tornadoes embedded in outer rainbands, and prolonged port closure/disruption.
